title: How to Make Vegan Blueberry Muffins

steps.headline: Prepare the muffin tray.
steps.description: Insert some muffin wrappers into each muffin tin or apply some cooking oil into each muffin tin to prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Combine all the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl incorporate baking powder, brown sugar, white sugar, all-purpose flour, white whole wheat flour and salt until well combined.

steps.headline: Add wet ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the plant milk, mashed banana, and oil then stir until the batter is moistened and well combined.

steps.headline: Pop in blueberries.
steps.description: Toss the blueberries into the mixture. Gently fold the blueberries into the batter until well combined.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the muffin tray tins.
steps.description: Scoop 3/4 cup of the batter and pour it into each muffin tin until all the batter is used.

steps.headline: Bake the muffins.
steps.description: Place the muffins in the oven and bake for 17-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place the muffins on a plate and enjoy with a cup of tea.

text:
Preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C). {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b2\/Make-Vegan-Blueberry-Muffins-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b2\/Make-Vegan-Blueberry-Muffins-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Prepare the muffin tray. Insert some muffin wrappers into each muffin tin or apply some cooking oil into each muffin tin to prevent sticking. Combine all the dry ingredients. In a large bowl incorporate baking powder, brown sugar, white sugar, all-purpose flour, white whole wheat flour and salt until well combined. Add wet ingredients. Pour the plant milk, mashed banana, and oil then stir until the batter is moistened and well combined. Pop in blueberries. Toss the blueberries into the mixture. Gently fold the blueberries into the batter until well combined. Pour the batter into the muffin tray tins. Scoop 3/4 cup of the batter and pour it into each muffin tin until all the batter is used. Bake the muffins. Place the muffins in the oven and bake for 17-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Serve. Place the muffins on a plate and enjoy with a cup of tea.
